appearances.snippet: oregon senator ron wyden, quick to respond to the shooting in portland, posting a message on social media, reading here in part, i'm monitoring the first awful reports of two people shot in portland by federal law enforcement. trump's deployment of federal agents in my hometown is clearly inflaming violence and must end. the shooting in portland comes just a day after the deadly shooting of a woman by an ice officer in minneapolis. federal authorities are calling that shooting an act of self-defense, saying that 37 year old rene good was using her vehicle as a weapon. minnesota officials and witnesses dispute the administration's portrayal. good's ex-husband says she had just dropped her child off at school and had no history of political activism. but vice president jd vance calling yesterday's incident a tragedy of the victim's making. >> she was. >> trying to ram this guy with his with her car, he shot back. he defended himself. he's already been seriously wounded in law enforcement operations before. >> from the president to the vice president to kristi noem, have stood and told you t

appearances.snippet: senator ron wyden just posted online in part, quote, trump's deployment of federal agents in my hometown want to be clear with our audience about what we know, and now has not confirmed what federal agents were involved in this shooting, but we are actively monitoring what is happening in portland. then in minneapolis, protests for a second night in the streets. look at this. this crowd that you're seeing. this is in response to the shooting of rene nicolle. good by an ice agent. yesterday, miss good died as a result of that shooting. >> you know, michael, i am not surprised to see that number of people turning out and protesting in minneapolis. it has been my experience all day. i wonder if you have had the same of people who ordinarily do not talk to me about news or politics coming up to me specifically to talk about what is happening in minneapolis. i cannot explain to you exactly why it is, but something about this story has struck a nerve with people who ordinarily do not think it is neighborly to be talking about such things. >> yeah, i think in a lot of ways it's the nature of th
